headline: Poll: Trump-Endorsed J.D. Vance Holds 3-Point Lead over Tim Ryan in Ohio Senate Race
author: Wendell Huseb√∏
sentences:
Vance 42% (+3)
(D) Tim Ryan 39%
Suffolk U Ohio Polling Accuracy
2016: Overstated Dems by 8.2 points
2018: Overstated Dems by 12 points
Ohio Electorate: R+8 in 2020 (CNN)
State Sample: R36/D32/I32 (R+4)https://t.co/o1qXtte18Q
The poll sampled 500 likely Ohio midterm voters from May 22-24 with a four-point margin of error.
The Director of Suffolk University's Political Research Center, David Paleologos, told the Cincinnati Enquirer that Vance has the momentum due to President Biden's 40-year-high inflation.
Here's Ryan trying to emerge from the quicksand  and he's getting drawn back into it because the problem of the economy is so ominous in Ohio, Paleologos said.
Vance holds a three-point lead over Rep. Tim Ryan (D-OH), according to a Wednesday USA Today Network Ohio-Suffolk University poll.
Nearly 50 percent of those polled said they hope their vote changes the direction of President Biden's economy.
Vance  who has been endorsed by Donald Trump  leads with 42 percent, while Ryan is stuck at 39 percent.
Seventeen percent of voters said they were undecided about who the next Senator from Ohio should be.
According to a Tuesday Gallup poll, only one percent said Biden's economy is excellent.
Additional polling reflects that the economy is voters' number one concern.
Eighty-five percent said Biden's economy is poor or only fair.
Follow Wendell Huseb on Twitter and Gettr @WendellHuseb.
He is the author of Politics of Slave Morality.

2022 OH Senate General Election Poll
(R) J.D.
